project.name: Atlassian JIRA - Webapp
project.description: JIRA provides cutting edge issue tracking and project management.

requirePluginVersions.message: Best Practice is to always define plugin versions!

banVersionDeps.message: Milestone and Release Candidate dependencies are not allowed in releases.

bannedDependencies.message: Something is including an old version of the Servlet API. | | The servlet API artifactId has changed, and depending on the old version at a scope other | than provided can cause problems. Dependencies with scope provided are OK, as 3.0 is API | compatible with 2.x. | | If you hit this enforcer rule despite using scope provided, be aware that Maven 3.0.5 (at | least) can compute dependencies wrong, so you may need to add exclusions elements to your | poms as guided by occurrences of javax.servlet:servlet-api in dependency:tree output. |
spring-scanner-runtime 1.x must be 'runtime' scoped in plugins (see CONFDEV-39702); spring-scanner-runtime 2.x must NOT be embedded, should not be depended on at all (see SCANNER-17).
spring-scanner-annotations 1.x must be 'compile' scoped in plugins (see CONFDEV-39702); 2.x annotations must be 'provided' scope (see SCANNER-17).
Something is depending on google-collections (perhaps transitively), but we use guava
Something is depending on javax.mail:mail (perhaps transitively), but we use javax.mail:javax.mail-api and com.sun.mail:javax.mail
